title: A neural network approach to predict opioid misuse among previously hospitalized patients using electronic health records
details: L Vega, W Conneen, MA Veronin, RP Schumaker - PLOS ONE, 2024
abstract: Can Electronic Health Records (EHR) predict opioid misuse in general patient populations? This research trained three backpropagation neural networks to explore EHR predictors using existing patient data. Model 1 used patient diagnosis …

title: Feasibility of structuring electronic health record data to facilitate real‐world data research: ICAREdata methods applied to multicenter cancer clinical trials
details: S George, N Campbell, SL Hillman, ES Harlos… - Cancer, 2024
abstract: Background The use of electronic health record (EHR) data for research is limited by a lack of structure and a standard data model. The objective of the ICAREdata (Integrating Clinical Trials and Real‐World Endpoints Data) project was to structure …

title: Applying text-mining to clinical notes: The identification of patient characteristics from Electronic Health Records (EHRs)
details: S ten Hoope, K Welvaars, K van Geijtenbeek… - 2024
abstract: Background Clinical notes contain information on critical patient characteristics, which, if overlooked, could escalate the risk of adverse events as well as miscommunication between the healthcare professional and the patient. This study …
